p: The second part of the attributes’ selection process was selecting the five most important attributes. This was done with the support of graphical representation afforded by the ‘Resilience Wheel’ by Aldunce et al. ( 2014b) (See Fig. 6), where all participants could see each other’s selections and discuss their choices. Table 5 ranks selections made on the questionnaire and the wheel, in total and by region. In this table, it is possible to see the diversity of preferences between the first (individual) and second (with discussion) selection during workshops.
